item.title: Two experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective is to assist the EU Delegation in the preparation of detailed designs of two programmes 2017-2020 in support of democratisation: 1) electoral reforms, and 2) parliamentary reforms.

The specific objectives are:

  • Study the sectors context, conduct stakeholder analysis and assess feasibility.
  • Conduct multi-stakeholder consultations to obtain a consensus and good level of ownership from all relevant counterparts for the future programmes.
  • Advise on possible modalities of assistance acceptable to beneficiaries.
  • Develop full set of draft programming documents required for the project identification, formulation and contracting for two programmes (1. electoral reforms, and 2. parliamentary reforms).

Two Experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)

  • Master degree in one or more of the following fields: social or political sciences, law, public administration or any other relevant discipline. If an expert does not hold a master degree, then as an equivalent he must possess the first university degree and 3 years of relevant general professional experience in excess of the 12 years defined below.
  • Each of the experts must possess a minimum of 12 years of professional experience in the sector directly related to the LOT and specifically in democratisation processes, electoral and parliamentary reforms.

  • The two experts need to possess as a minimum a complementary experience and expertise to cover all the following fields:

  • development work in relation to democratisation, electoral reforms, electoral process, election management, in parliamentary support, capacity building and inclusion of media and civil society in elections related activities;

  • programming of the budget support modalities, development of the EU programming documents such as identification fiches, action documents and all the related annexes, policy analysis;

  • contemporary approaches to democracy, the key challenges and achievements to date;

  • good knowledge of Pakistan political landscape including the functioning of the democratic institutions, the framework in which they operate, the relation between the federal and provincial level, rules, procedures, powers and functions, political parties and of the functioning of the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP);

  • cooperation with donors, international organisations, public administrations and civil society in the sector.
